name: alternated
content:
Add to word list

past simple and past participle of
alternate
C1 [ I usually + adv/prep ] to happen or exist one after the other repeatedly: She alternated between cheerfulness and deep despair.
[ T usually + adv/prep ] to make something happen or exist one after the other repeatedly: He alternated working in the office with long tours overseas.
More examplesFewer examplesIn this type of mental illness, the usual pattern is bouts of depression alternating with elation.Throughout the holiday, the weather alternated between rain and sunshine every day.She swam up and down, alternating between crawl and backstroke.Saturdays at the club alternate between 1970s disco and house/garage.The area boasts miles of unspoilt coastline alternating between cliffs and sandy beaches.
